questions.text: Identify the anatomical structures related on visceral surface of spleen marked as A, B, C in image respectively?

options.label: A
options.text: Right kidney, stomach, hepatic flexure of colon

options.label: B
options.text: Right kidney, stomach, splenic flexure of colon

options.label: C
options.text: Left kidney, stomach, splenic flexure of colon

options.label: D
options.text: Stomach, left kidney, splenic flexure of colon

questions.correct_answer: D. Stomach, left kidney, splenic flexure of colon
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Stomach, left kidney, splenic flexure of colon

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The visceral surface of the spleen is related to three main structures: the stomach (gastric impression) , left kidney (renal impression) , and splenic flexure of the colon (colic impression) . These relationships are critical during surgical approaches to the spleen.
  • ➤ visceral surface of the spleen
  • ➤ stomach (gastric impression)
  • ➤ left kidney (renal impression)
  • ➤ splenic flexure of the colon (colic impression)

questions.text: During thoracotomy operation which structure is identified by beaded structure?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Pecquet duct

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The thoracic duct is identified during thoracotomy by its beaded appearance , caused by the presence of multiple valves, and drains lymph into the left jugular-subclavian angle .
  • ➤ thoracic duct
  • ➤ beaded appearance
  • ➤ left jugular-subclavian angle

questions.text: During development of spiral valve in truncus arteriosus if abnormality occurs then it can result in Cyanotic heart diseases. Which of the following disease is related with this situation?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) OF

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Abnormal development of the spiral valve in truncus arteriosus leads to Tetralogy of Fallot (TOF) , characterized by pulmonary stenosis, overriding of the aorta, VSD, and right ventricular hypertrophy. A classic radiological sign of TOF is the boot-shaped heart .
  • ➤ spiral valve in truncus arteriosus
  • ➤ Tetralogy of Fallot (TOF)
  • ➤ boot-shaped heart

questions.text: Identify the instrument:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Microtome

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The microtome is a crucial tool in histopathology, used to prepare ultra-thin tissue sections for microscopic examination.
  • ➤ microtome

questions.text: Which of the following is not the lateral branch of abdominal aorta?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Inferior mesenteric artery

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The inferior mesenteric artery is a ventral branch of the abdominal aorta, while the lateral branches include the inferior phrenic, middle suprarenal, renal, and gonadal arteries.
  • ➤ inferior mesenteric artery

questions.text: Type I Collagen is present in all except:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Cartilage

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Type I collagen is found in bone, aponeurosis, and ligaments, but cartilage is an exception as it primarily contains Type II collagen .
  • ➤ Type I collagen
  • ➤ cartilage
  • ➤ Type II collagen

questions.text: A 75 year old male presented with history of frequency, hesitancy & urgency for urination. He was on medication of Tamsulosin & Finasteride combination. Now Trans Urethral Resection of Prostate (TURP) surgery was recommended by physician. Why TURP is preferred over suprapubic prostectomy?

options.label: A
options.text: Prostatic venous plexus is located in between the true & false capsule of prostate & presented clinical condition involves peripheral zone of prostate.

options.label: B
options.text: Prostatic venous plexus is located below the true capsule of prostate & presented clinical condition involves peripheral zone of prostate.

options.label: C
options.text: Prostatic venous plexus is located in between the true & false capsule of prostate & presented clinical condition involves periurethral zone of prostate.

options.label: D
options.text: Prostatic venous plexus is located outside the false capsule of prostate & presented clinical condition involves periurethral zone of prostate.

questions.correct_answer: C. Prostatic venous plexus is located in between the true & false capsule of prostate & presented clinical condition involves periurethral zone of prostate.
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Prostatic venous plexus is located in between the true & false capsule of prostate & presented clinical condition involves periurethral zone of prostate

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ TURP is preferred in BPH because it minimizes damage to the prostatic venous plexus (located between the true and false capsule) and allows targeted removal of the periurethral zone , which is the site of enlargement in BPH.
  • ➤ TURP
  • ➤ prostatic venous plexus
  • ➤ periurethral zone

questions.text: A patient presented with pain on left tip of shoulder. On examination splenic rupture was found. Which dermatome is involved in this “Kehr’s sign”?
questions.explanation: Ans. B. C345

questions.text: The type of joint marked in the image below is:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Synovial

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The costovertebral joint is a plane synovial joint , allowing gliding movements essential for respiratory function.
  • ➤ costovertebral joint
  • ➤ plane synovial joint

questions.text: The movements at the_________joint permit a person to look to the right and left?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Atlanto-axial

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The atlanto-axial joint is a pivot joint responsible for the rotational ('no') motion of the head, while the atlanto-occipital joint is an ellipsoid joint that enables the flexion/extension ('yes') motion.
  • ➤ atlanto-axial joint
  • ➤ pivot joint
  • ➤ atlanto-occipital joint
  • ➤ ellipsoid joint

questions.text: Cholecystocaval line is in between?

options.label: D
options.text: It is anatomical demarcation between right and left lobe of liver

questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Gall bladder & IVC

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Cholecystocaval line (Cantlie’s line) is an imaginary line passing between the gallbladder and the IVC , representing the functional midline of the liver used in surgical procedures.
  • ➤ Cholecystocaval line (Cantlie’s line)
  • ➤ gallbladder
  • ➤ IVC

questions.text: Vitamin A storing liver cell is?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Ito cells

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Ito cells (hepatic stellate cells) in the space of Disse are responsible for storing vitamin A in the liver. They play a critical role in maintaining vitamin A reserves and overall liver health.
  • ➤ Ito cells (hepatic stellate cells)
  • ➤ space of Disse

questions.text: Incudostapedial joint is:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Ball & Socket

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The incudostapedial joint is a ball and socket joint , facilitating precise movement required for the effective transmission of sound waves in the middle ear.
  • ➤ incudostapedial joint
  • ➤ ball and socket joint

questions.text: In femoral hernia surgery it is very important to give proper incisions. To increase diameter of femoral canal, we have to cut lacunar ligament & protect the inguinal & pectineal ligaments. Identify the ligaments in image?

options.label: A
options.text: A-Inguinal ligament, B-lacunar ligament, C-Pectineal ligament

options.label: B
options.text: A-Lacunar ligament, B-Inguinal ligament, C-Pectineal ligament

options.label: C
options.text: A-Pectineal ligament, B-Inguinal ligament, C-Lacunar ligament

questions.correct_answer: D. A-Inguinal ligament,B-Pectineal ligament, C-Lacunar ligament
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) A-Inguinal ligament,B-Pectineal ligament, C-Lacunar ligament

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In femoral hernia surgeries:
  • ➤ Lacunar ligament is cut to expand the femoral canal. Inguinal ligament and pectineal ligament must be protected. The mnemonic LIP (Lacunar, Inguinal, Pectineal) helps recall the ligaments related to femoral hernias.
  • ➤ Lacunar ligament is cut to expand the femoral canal.
  • ➤ Lacunar ligament
  • ➤ Inguinal ligament and pectineal ligament must be protected. The mnemonic LIP (Lacunar, Inguinal, Pectineal) helps recall the ligaments related to femoral hernias.
  • ➤ Inguinal ligament
  • ➤ pectineal ligament
  • ➤ LIP

questions.text: Greater & lesser sciatic notches are important part of hip bone. These notches act like gateway for pelvic cavity through which many important structures passes. In between these 2 notches one important bony landmark is located as marked in image. Which procedure is related with indicated area?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Pudendal nerve block

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The ischial spine is the key landmark for performing a pudendal nerve block , which is commonly used in perineal procedures to anesthetize the pudendal nerve.
  • ➤ ischial spine
  • ➤ pudendal nerve block

questions.text: Which structure doesn’t contract in case of diaphragmatic constriction:
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) A

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Inferior Vena Cava (IVC) , passing through the central tendon of the diaphragm at T8, is non-contractile and expands during diaphragmatic contraction to enhance venous return .
  • ➤ Inferior Vena Cava (IVC)
  • ➤ central tendon
  • ➤ venous return

questions.text: Harris dictum is related to which viscera:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Spleen

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Harris dictum summarizes the odd measurements, weight, and location of the spleen , helping in its anatomical and clinical understanding.
  • ➤ Harris dictum
  • ➤ odd measurements, weight, and location of the spleen

questions.text: A 13 years old male Sulabh, presented with pain in right iliac fossa, vomiting & fever. On blood examination leucocytosis was found in this patient point of maximum tenderness is?

options.label: A
options.text: Junction between lateral 2/3 rd & medial 1/3 rd between umblico- spinal line

options.label: B
options.text: Junction between medial 2/3 rd & lateral 1/3 rd between umblico- spinal line

options.label: C
options.text: Junction between lateral 3/5 th & medial 2/5 th between umblico- spinal line

options.label: D
options.text: Junction between lateral 2/5 th & medial 3/5 th between umblico- spinal line

questions.correct_answer: B. Junction between medial 2/3 rd & lateral 1/3 rd between umblico- spinal line
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Junction between medial 2/3rd& lateral 1/3rdbetween umblico- spinal line

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The maximum tenderness in acute appendicitis is typically felt at McBurney’s point , located at the junction between the medial two-thirds and lateral one-third of the line between the umbilicus and anterior superior iliac spine (ASIS) .
  • ➤ maximum tenderness in acute appendicitis
  • ➤ McBurney’s point
  • ➤ medial two-thirds
  • ➤ lateral one-third
  • ➤ umbilicus and anterior superior iliac spine (ASIS)

questions.text: A 26-year-old woman was admitted in the emergency room with severe epigastric pain with radiation to the back, nausea, anorexia, jaundice, 38.5 ºC fever, headache and myalgia. Examination revealed a woman with severe jaundice, pallor, and epigastric abdominal pain during superficial palpation, with no peritonitis signs. Her liver was enlarged, exceeding costal margin by 2 cm. Laboratory investigations showed serum aspartate aminotransferase (AST) 1,285 IU/L (13-35 IU/dL), alanine aminotransferase (ALT) 666 IU/L (7-35 IU/dL), lipase 1,012 IU/L (≤ 200 IU/L), amylase 149 IU/L (20-110UI/L). She was diagnosed with acute pancreatitis. In this case which arterial aneurism may be seen?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Splenic artery

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In acute pancreatitis , the most common arterial aneurysm occurs in the splenic artery due to its anatomical proximity and exposure to digestive enzymes. The presence of Cullen’s and Grey-Turner’s signs suggests severe pancreatitis with retroperitoneal hemorrhage.
  • ➤ acute pancreatitis
  • ➤ splenic artery

questions.text: Fascia shown in image is known as------- & it is attached to------------- vertebra:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Diaphragm of neck; C7

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Sibson’s fascia (suprapleural membrane) is the diaphragm of the neck , separating the thorax and neck and attached medially to the transverse process of C7 vertebra .
  • ➤ Sibson’s fascia (suprapleural membrane)
  • ➤ diaphragm of the neck
  • ➤ transverse process of C7 vertebra

questions.text: Extra rib present above 1 st rib and below 12 th rib are known as:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Cervical rib & Gorilla rib

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Extra ribs in humans include:
  • ➤ Cervical rib : Extra rib above the 1st rib (C7 vertebra). Gorilla rib : Extra rib below the 12th rib, resembling the 13th rib in primates.
  • ➤ Cervical rib : Extra rib above the 1st rib (C7 vertebra).
  • ➤ Cervical rib
  • ➤ Gorilla rib : Extra rib below the 12th rib, resembling the 13th rib in primates.
  • ➤ Gorilla rib

questions.text: In shown image one important structure is present which is joined to 3 systems of body during embryonic period (CVS, GIT & Excretory system). What is the vertebral level of this embryonic structure:
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) L3 – L4

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The umbilicus is located at the vertebral level of L3–L4 , serving as a key anatomical landmark during development and in clinical practice.
  • ➤ umbilicus
  • ➤ L3–L4

questions.text: A man was brought to the emergency department after he fell into a manhole and injured his perineum. He was unable to pass urine and blood was seen at the tip of the urethra. A diagnosis of bulbar urethral injury was made. Where do you least expect the urine to get collected in this case?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Medial portion of thigh

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of bulbar urethral injury , urine extravasates into the perineum, scrotum, and anterior abdominal wall but does not collect in the medial portion of the thigh due to the restrictive boundary of the fascia lata.
  • ➤ bulbar urethral injury
  • ➤ perineum, scrotum, and anterior abdominal wall
  • ➤ medial portion of the thigh

questions.text: This type of tissue is found in?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Ureter

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Transitional epithelium is characteristic of the urinary tract , particularly the ureters , urinary bladder , and renal pelvis , allowing these organs to stretch and return to their normal size.
  • ➤ Transitional epithelium
  • ➤ urinary tract
  • ➤ ureters
  • ➤ urinary bladder
  • ➤ renal pelvis

questions.text: Neurovascular bundle of thoracic & abdominal cavity runs in between the:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Middle and inner layers

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The neurovascular bundle (VAN) of the thoracic and abdominal cavity runs between the middle layer (internal oblique/internal intercostal) and the innermost layer (innermost intercostal/transversus abdominis) . Always remember this relationship to avoid damage during procedures like thoracocentesis.
  • ➤ neurovascular bundle (VAN)
  • ➤ middle layer (internal oblique/internal intercostal)
  • ➤ innermost layer (innermost intercostal/transversus abdominis)

questions.text: Identify vertebra:
questions.correct_answer: D. A-Cervical, B- Thoracic, C- Lumbar
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) A-Cervical, B- Thoracic, C- Lumbar

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ To identify vertebrae:
  • ➤ Cervical vertebrae have transverse foramina (foramen transversarium). Thoracic vertebrae have long spines and costal facets for rib articulation. Lumbar vertebrae have large bodies, short spines, and triangular vertebral canals.
  • ➤ Cervical vertebrae have transverse foramina (foramen transversarium).
  • ➤ Thoracic vertebrae have long spines and costal facets for rib articulation.
  • ➤ Lumbar vertebrae have large bodies, short spines, and triangular vertebral canals.

questions.text: Correct regarding given muscle in image:

options.label: A
options.text: I- Linea semilunaris, II- Linea alba, III – Inguinal ligament, IV- Inner lip of iliac crest

options.label: B
options.text: I- Linea alba, II- Arcuate ligament, III –Lacunar ligament, IV- Outer lip of iliac crest

options.label: C
options.text: I- Linea alba, II- Linea semilunaris, III – Inguinal ligament, IV- Inner lip of iliac crest

options.label: D
options.text: I- Linea alba, II- Linea semilunaris, III – Inguinal ligament, IV- Outer lip of iliac

questions.correct_answer: D. I- Linea alba, II- Linea semilunaris, III – Inguinal ligament, IV- Outer lip of iliac
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) I- Linea alba, II- Linea semilunaris, III – Inguinal ligament, IV- Outer lip of iliac crest

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The external oblique muscle of the anterior abdominal wall is characterized by the linea alba (midline), linea semilunaris (lateral edge of rectus abdominis), inguinal ligament (lower free edge), and insertion on the outer lip of the iliac crest.

questions.text: During hepatobiliary surgery indicated procedure as shown image was performed to prevent bleeding and biliary leakage. In this procedure the index finger is inserted along free margin of lesser omentum. It is done at which vertebral level:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) T12

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The epiploic foramen (foramen of Winslow) , through which the index finger passes during Pringle’s maneuver , is located at the T12 vertebral level . This anatomical knowledge is crucial during hepatobiliary surgeries to avoid complications.
  • ➤ epiploic foramen (foramen of Winslow)
  • ➤ Pringle’s maneuver
  • ➤ T12 vertebral level

questions.text: Which of the following are branches of the anterior division of the internal iliac artery? 1. Superior gluteal artery 2. Inferior gluteal artery 3. Superior vesical artery 4. Middle rectal artery 5. Inferior vesical artery 6. Vaginal artery
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 2, 3, 4, 5, 6

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The anterior division of the internal iliac artery provides branches that predominantly supply the pelvic viscera, including the inferior gluteal artery, superior vesical artery, middle rectal artery, inferior vesical artery (males), and vaginal artery (females).
  • ➤ inferior gluteal artery, superior vesical artery, middle rectal artery, inferior vesical artery (males), and vaginal artery (females).

questions.text: Middle colic artery is branch of:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Superior mesenteric artery

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The middle colic artery , which supplies the transverse colon, is a branch of the superior mesenteric artery (SMA) .
  • ➤ middle colic artery
  • ➤ superior mesenteric artery (SMA)

questions.text: A tumor of the uncinate process of the pancreas affects which of the following vessels?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Superior mesenteric artery

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A tumor in the uncinate process of the pancreas commonly compresses the superior mesenteric artery and vein due to their close anatomical relationship.
  • ➤ uncinate process of the pancreas
  • ➤ superior mesenteric artery

questions.text: Brain and spinal cord develops from:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Neuroectoderm

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The brain and spinal cord develop from the neuroectoderm , which is a specialized part of the ectoderm. The neuroectoderm forms the neural plate, which gives rise to the neural groove, neural tube, and eventually the CNS.
  • ➤ brain and spinal cord
  • ➤ neuroectoderm

questions.text: Which muscle develops from 1 st pharyngeal arch?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Anterior belly of digastric

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The anterior belly of digastric is derived from the 1st pharyngeal arch , along with the muscles of mastication, mylohyoid, tensor tympani, and tensor veli palatini. These muscles are all innervated by the mandibular nerve (V3) .
  • ➤ anterior belly of digastric
  • ➤ 1st pharyngeal arch
  • ➤ mandibular nerve (V3)

questions.text: The following image shows transverse section of spinal cord in the cervical region of human embryo, early in the 6 th week of life. Identify the position of the notochord in the image below?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) C

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The notochord is positioned ventral to the neural tube in the developing embryo and serves as the foundation for the vertebral column and the signaling center for early neural and skeletal development.
  • ➤ notochord

questions.text: Which of the following Clinical condition may be seen in tissue shown in image:
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Cardiomyopathy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Cardiac muscle tissue is identified by its branching fibers, centrally located nuclei, and intercalated discs. These features are crucial in understanding conditions such as cardiomyopathy, which affects the structure and function of the cardiac muscle.

questions.text: A 38-week gestational age infant was noted to have thick secretions and difficulty in breathing on the first day of life. An orogastric tube was unable to be passed into the stomach as shown in image. For treatment thoracotomy surgery was decided. Which of the following will be best approach?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Postero-lateral thoracotomy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For surgical repair of tracheoesophageal fistula and esophageal atresia, the postero-lateral thoracotomy approach is preferred due to its direct access to the posterior mediastinum while avoiding anterior structures like the heart and lungs
  • ➤ postero-lateral thoracotomy

questions.text: For RFA of AV node following triangle is targeted in clinical. All of the followings are at boundaries of this triangle except?
questions.correct_answer: D. Anterior leaflet of tricuspid valve
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Anterior leaflet of tricuspid valve

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Koch's triangle is an essential anatomical landmark in the right atrium, bounded by:
  • ➤ Koch's triangle
  • ➤ Tendon of Todaro (Subendocardial ridge) Opening of Coronary Sinus Septal Leaflet of Tricuspid Valve
  • ➤ Tendon of Todaro (Subendocardial ridge)
  • ➤ Tendon of Todaro (Subendocardial ridge)
  • ➤ Opening of Coronary Sinus
  • ➤ Opening of Coronary Sinus
  • ➤ Septal Leaflet of Tricuspid Valve
  • ➤ Septal Leaflet of Tricuspid Valve
  • ➤ The Anterior Leaflet of the Tricuspid Valve is not part of this boundary.
  • ➤ Anterior Leaflet of the Tricuspid Valve
  • ➤ not

questions.text: During cardiopulmonary surgery there was need to ligate ascending aorta & pulmonary trunk. Where these structures can be ligated at?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Transverse sinus

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The transverse sinus is the anatomical space used during cardiopulmonary surgeries to ligate or clamp the ascending aorta and pulmonary trunk , critical for controlling blood flow during procedures.
  • ➤ transverse sinus
  • ➤ ascending aorta
  • ➤ pulmonary trunk

questions.text: Identify the marked structure?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Heister’s valve

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Hister's valve is located in the neck of the gallbladder and helps maintain bile flow through the cystic duct. It is a false valve , and its anatomy is significant for conditions like gallstones in Hartmann’s pouch.
  • ➤ Hister's valve
  • ➤ neck of the gallbladder
  • ➤ false valve
  • ➤ gallstones

questions.text: Indicated duct opens into:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Minor duodenal papilla

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The accessory pancreatic duct opens into the minor duodenal papilla , which is distinct from the major duodenal papilla where the main pancreatic duct terminates.
  • ➤ accessory pancreatic duct
  • ➤ minor duodenal papilla

questions.text: Which dermatome is involved in Kehr’s sign?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) C345

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Kehr’s sign is caused by referred pain to the C3, C4, and C5 dermatomes due to irritation of the diaphragm, most commonly following splenic rupture.
  • ➤ C3, C4, and C5 dermatomes

questions.text: Identify the pelvic diaphragm?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) B

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The pelvic diaphragm is formed by the levator ani muscle (pubococcygeus, iliococcygeus, and puborectalis) and the coccygeus muscle , which collectively support pelvic organs and separate the pelvic cavity from the perineum.
  • ➤ pelvic diaphragm
  • ➤ levator ani muscle
  • ➤ coccygeus muscle

questions.text: A patient with positive Murphy’s sign on clinical suspicion underwent cholecystectomy. On histopathological examination the finding is normal. The gall bladder epithelium will be?
questions.correct_answer: C. Simple Columnar with brush border
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The normal gallbladder epithelium is simple columnar , which is essential for its function of concentrating bile through water and electrolyte absorption.
  • ➤ simple columnar

questions.text: In shown slide blank zones are due to:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Fat washed in alcohol

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The blank zones in histological slides of adipose tissue are caused by fat being dissolved in alcohol or acetone during slide preparation.
  • ➤ fat being dissolved in alcohol or acetone

questions.text: Shown artery divides in which intercostal space:
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 6th

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The internal thoracic artery bifurcates into the superior epigastric artery and musculophrenic artery at the 6th intercostal space .
  • ➤ internal thoracic artery
  • ➤ superior epigastric artery
  • ➤ musculophrenic artery
  • ➤ 6th intercostal space

questions.text: Which of the following statement is/ are correct for below clinical situation:

options.label: A
options.text: It is case of Meningocele, due to folic acid deficiency, which resulted in failure of closure of neural tube on 28 th day of IUL.

options.label: B
options.text: It is case of Meningomyelocele, due to folic acid deficiency, which resulted in failure of closure of neural tube on 28 th day of IUL.

options.label: C
options.text: It is case of Anencephaly due to folic acid deficiency, which resulted in failure of closure of neural tube on 25 th day of IUL.

options.label: D
options.text: It is case of Anencephaly due to folic acid deficiency, which resulted in failure of closure of neural tube on 28 th day of IUL.

questions.correct_answer: C. It is case of Anencephaly due to folic acid deficiency, which resulted in failure of closure of neural tube on 25 th day of IUL.
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) It is case of Anencephaly due to folic acid deficiency, which resulted in failure of closure of neural tube on 25thday of IUL

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Anencephaly occurs due to the failure of anterior neural tube closure by the 25th day of IUL and is strongly linked to folic acid deficiency during pregnancy.
  • ➤ Anencephaly
  • ➤ 25th day of IUL
  • ➤ folic acid deficiency

questions.text: A 53-year-old female with recurrent medical history presented to the local emergency department with complaints of fever, headaches, and left eye swelling. The patient and her husband visited many times to their parents village at latin America, where they give history of sleeping on a bed net-covered wooden platform bed in a one-room cottage often that lacked netted windows and doors. Now she has features of dysphagia also. Barium swallow examination was done and following feature was seen as shown in image. Which of the following is responsible for this clinical situation?

options.label: A
options.text: Failure of migration of neural crest cells.

options.label: B
options.text: Abnormal Hyaluronic acid activity during embryonic life

questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Chronic trypanosomiasis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The bird’s beak sign on barium swallow and dysphagia in a patient from Latin America suggest achalasia cardia secondary to chronic trypanosomiasis (Chagas disease) , caused by Trypanosoma cruzi infection.
  • ➤ bird’s beak sign
  • ➤ achalasia cardia
  • ➤ chronic trypanosomiasis (Chagas disease)
  • ➤ Trypanosoma cruzi

questions.text: Portal vein is formed at which vertebral level?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) L2

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The portal vein is formed at the L2 vertebral level , behind the neck of the pancreas, by the union of the splenic vein and the superior mesenteric vein .
  • ➤ portal vein
  • ➤ L2 vertebral level
  • ➤ splenic vein
  • ➤ superior mesenteric vein

questions.text: Which structure develops from arrow marked structure shown in image:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Tonsil

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The second pharyngeal pouch forms the palatine tonsils , which are part of the lymphatic system and play a role in immune defense.
  • ➤ second pharyngeal pouch
  • ➤ palatine tonsils

questions.text: A patient has history of splenic trauma & severe intraperitoneal bleeding. To prevent shock, you will occlude which structure?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) D

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of splenic trauma with severe bleeding, occlusion of the splenic artery within the splenorenal ligament (D) is the most effective way to prevent hemorrhagic shock.
  • ➤ splenic artery within the splenorenal ligament
